Comment: In a perfect world, his tariff plan is aimed at bring more industry back domestically, which would help those people who don’t own stocks/ real estate, and who aren’t office working professionals.    However, tariffs without a massive plan to prepare Americans infrastructure and supply/ distribution systems for the influx of activity, simply isn’t going to work.   This plan ends up being regressive sales tax on people who can’t afford 10-40% price increases.    Maybe this effort works in a single party governing system, but we have a slow and constantly changing system with competing philosophies every few years…
